summary: “I think it had come from the hotel where the crew were staying.  We went, as I later found out, three hours in the wrong...
caption: “I think it had come from the hotel where the crew were staying.  We went, as I later found out, three hours in the wrong direction on the tracks.  Then, we swiveled around and went three hours back and then continued to our destination.  It was about ten hours as I remember.  I arrived in the dark with an empty bottle of scotch, which I had shared with the non-English speaking train engineer, and exited into a tunnel through the snow and into the hotel where the crew and the cast was.” - Harrison Ford on the time he drank a bottle of scotch while trying to film The Empire Strikes Back

tags: h ELP ME for I cannot colour metal
summary: ALRIGHT I have brilliant news and that news is that this commission is finished! I have never pushed myself so hard to colour so...
caption:
ALRIGHT I have brilliant news and that news is that this commission is finished! I have never pushed myself so hard to colour so to finish this is a great (and lovely looking) weight off my chest.

Here is a 25 for 25 commission for @avashnea of their smuggler, Mikaah

I’m gonna take a few days to like…. revive myself but thank you THANK YOU, for being so patient and I really mean that because hot damn this was a big one.

summary: Star Wars: Resistance I have seen eight episodes now. Neeku. My Force, Neeku is a precious, precious soul. Honestly, I’m not...
body:
Star Wars: Resistance

I have seen eight episodes now.

Neeku. My Force, Neeku is a precious, precious soul. Honestly, I’m not sure if I care about the overarching storyline, or Kaz, but I will delightedly watch the rest of Resistance to see precious, kind-hearted Neeku.

His intent is so kind. And his cheerfulness is beautiful.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary: Bandai Star Wars 1:1000 Blockade Runner Vehicle Model unboxing photoset November 30th, 2018 Here it is, the highly anticipated...
caption:
Bandai Star Wars 1:1000 Blockade Runner Vehicle Model unboxing photoset
November 30th, 2018

Here it is, the highly anticipated Corellilan Corvette, aka “Blockade Runner,” in 1:1000 scale by Bandai! Between this and the 1:72 B-Wing, Bandai really made me happy this year in terms of Star Wars kits this year. The detail on this kit is exquisite, and considering that it is in 1:1000 scale, nobody should complain about any inconsistent box scale. Stickers are provided instead of decals, but it should be possible to use these stickers as painting masks instead.

Here’s the ship’s bridge.

Some of the escape pods have been jettisoned.

It’s possible to run SMDs into these engines to light them up. the December 2018 issue of Model Graphix magazine shows how.

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: so, we all know that Plo is The Best Space Dad Ever, but is he also one of The Best Space Granddads? Grandmaster Koon with tiny...
question: so, we all know that Plo is The Best Space Dad Ever, but is he also one of The Best Space Granddads? Grandmaster Koon with tiny Ani? (also was Padawan Obi there when Plo found Asohka?) just more safewithplo, please Moddy. you're writing is so good!
answer:
When Anakin had been just a young boy and new in the temple, the nights had scared him along with the noises of Coruscant as the planet never really slept, its lights forever on unless you pulled the covers in front of your window.

In those early days…

Obi-Wan would appear in his doorway, his face soft with worry before he offered to sit with Anakin until he fell asleep.

That tradition eventually evolved into Anakin, on difficult nights only, seeking to sleep in Obi-Wan’s bed where the man would wrap an arm around Anakin and tuck the blankets tightly around them both for warmth.

His cheek pressed to the man’s chest where he could instead listen to the steady thump of a heartbeat instead as his hand held onto the thick braid Obi-Wan put his hair in for sleep, just slightly braided to the side so it could be slung over the shoulder so he would not end laying on the long length.

It was soothing and as he grew older and no longer needed that comfort, Anakin treasured those memories, Obi-Wan’s thick braid in his hand, his steady heart instead of the traffic of Coruscant and the warming sensation in the Force that was Obi-Wan’s peace.

And then there was Master Plo, the kel dor often giving him his version of a wink before passing him some kind of sweet treat with Obi-Wan rolling his eyes in amusement before Anakin was sent off to class.

Plo and Obi-Wan were the best, Obi-Wan always looked after Anakin, was always there if something was wrong and if Anakin couldn’t talk to Obi-Wan then he could go and talk to Plo who would always make time for him if he wasn’t in the middle of something.

Anakin would often sit outside the council chamber and wait the last few minutes of the meeting inside until Plo came out, the kel dor greeting him fondly with a hair ruffle before passing him a clementine of all things from his pockets.

When Anakin had asked Obi-Wan about it during what was really his homework hour, Obi-Wan had snorted on his tea, bringing it up his nose before laughing while mopping at his nose and beard with his sleeve, explaining in a choked tone from hacking up tea that Plo started plying Obi-Wan with fruit and nuts when he was still the man’s padawan.

“Kel dor’s don’t eat like humans do, they don’t have teeth,” Obi-Wan had explained, calmer with a small smile on his face. “So Master Plo would stuff fruits and nuts into his pockets because he knew that it was healthy for growing padawans to eat fruits and nuts with all the vitamins, sugars and fats in the nuts especially. I guess he just never got out of the habit and now he can give you the same fruits he used to give me.” Obi-Wan chortled quietly while sitting back in the couch, a fond smile on his face.

Smiling a bit too, Anakin felt a warm glow all these years later as Plo placed an apple in the blonds hand before sending him off with Obi-Wan on a new mission here on Coruscant, Senator Amidala having come into problems with an assassin stalking her steps.

Anakin wasn’t sure but he had a feeling that if it had been just Obi-Wan and him… maybe Anakin wouldn’t be so happy.

As it was, he had Obi-Wan and he had Plo.

And maybe one day in the future he would have a little aunt or sister padawan in the togruta youngling that Plo had rescued?

Who knew.

The future was open for them to experience.

That tradition eventually evolved into Anakin, on difficult nights only, seeking to sleep in Obi-Wan’s bed where the man would wrap an arm around Anakin and tuck the blankets tightly around them both for warmth.

His cheek pressed to the man’s chest where he could instead listen to the steady thump of a heartbeat instead as his hand held onto the thick braid Obi-Wan put his hair in for sleep, just slightly braided to the side so it could be slung over the shoulder so he would not end laying on the long length.

It was soothing and as he grew older and no longer needed that comfort, Anakin treasured those memories, Obi-Wan’s thick braid in his hand, his steady heart instead of the traffic of Coruscant and the warming sensation in the Force that was Obi-Wan’s peace.

And then there was Master Plo, the kel dor often giving him his version of a wink before passing him some kind of sweet treat with Obi-Wan rolling his eyes in amusement before Anakin was sent off to class.

Plo and Obi-Wan were the best, Obi-Wan always looked after Anakin, was always there if something was wrong and if Anakin couldn’t talk to Obi-Wan then he could go and talk to Plo who would always make time for him if he wasn’t in the middle of something.

Anakin would often sit outside the council chamber and wait the last few minutes of the meeting inside until Plo came out, the kel dor greeting him fondly with a hair ruffle before passing him a clementine of all things from his pockets.

When Anakin had asked Obi-Wan about it during what was really his homework hour, Obi-Wan had snorted on his tea, bringing it up his nose before laughing while mopping at his nose and beard with his sleeve, explaining in a choked tone from hacking up tea that Plo started plying Obi-Wan with fruit and nuts when he was still the man’s padawan.

“Kel dor’s don’t eat like humans do, they don’t have teeth,” Obi-Wan had explained, calmer with a small smile on his face. “So Master Plo would stuff fruits and nuts into his pockets because he knew that it was healthy for growing padawans to eat fruits and nuts with all the vitamins, sugars and fats in the nuts especially. I guess he just never got out of the habit and now he can give you the same fruits he used to give me.” Obi-Wan chortled quietly while sitting back in the couch, a fond smile on his face.

Smiling a bit too, Anakin felt a warm glow all these years later as Plo placed an apple in the blonds hand before sending him off with Obi-Wan on a new mission here on Coruscant, Senator Amidala having come into problems with an assassin stalking her steps.

Anakin wasn’t sure but he had a feeling that if it had been just Obi-Wan and him… maybe Anakin wouldn’t be so happy.

As it was, he had Obi-Wan and he had Plo.

And maybe one day in the future he would have a little aunt or sister padawan in the togruta youngling that Plo had rescued?

Who knew.

The future was open for them to experience.
trail.content:
When Anakin had been just a young boy and new in the temple, the nights had scared him along with the noises of Coruscant as the planet never really slept, its lights forever on unless you pulled the covers in front of your window.

In those early days…

Obi-Wan would appear in his doorway, his face soft with worry before he offered to sit with Anakin until he fell asleep.

That tradition eventually evolved into Anakin, on difficult nights only, seeking to sleep in Obi-Wan’s bed where the man would wrap an arm around Anakin and tuck the blankets tightly around them both for warmth.

His cheek pressed to the man’s chest where he could instead listen to the steady thump of a heartbeat instead as his hand held onto the thick braid Obi-Wan put his hair in for sleep, just slightly braided to the side so it could be slung over the shoulder so he would not end laying on the long length.

It was soothing and as he grew older and no longer needed that comfort, Anakin treasured those memories, Obi-Wan’s thick braid in his hand, his steady heart instead of the traffic of Coruscant and the warming sensation in the Force that was Obi-Wan’s peace.

And then there was Master Plo, the kel dor often giving him his version of a wink before passing him some kind of sweet treat with Obi-Wan rolling his eyes in amusement before Anakin was sent off to class.

Plo and Obi-Wan were the best, Obi-Wan always looked after Anakin, was always there if something was wrong and if Anakin couldn’t talk to Obi-Wan then he could go and talk to Plo who would always make time for him if he wasn’t in the middle of something.

Anakin would often sit outside the council chamber and wait the last few minutes of the meeting inside until Plo came out, the kel dor greeting him fondly with a hair ruffle before passing him a clementine of all things from his pockets.

When Anakin had asked Obi-Wan about it during what was really his homework hour, Obi-Wan had snorted on his tea, bringing it up his nose before laughing while mopping at his nose and beard with his sleeve, explaining in a choked tone from hacking up tea that Plo started plying Obi-Wan with fruit and nuts when he was still the man’s padawan.

“Kel dor’s don’t eat like humans do, they don’t have teeth,” Obi-Wan had explained, calmer with a small smile on his face. “So Master Plo would stuff fruits and nuts into his pockets because he knew that it was healthy for growing padawans to eat fruits and nuts with all the vitamins, sugars and fats in the nuts especially. I guess he just never got out of the habit and now he can give you the same fruits he used to give me.” Obi-Wan chortled quietly while sitting back in the couch, a fond smile on his face.

Smiling a bit too, Anakin felt a warm glow all these years later as Plo placed an apple in the blonds hand before sending him off with Obi-Wan on a new mission here on Coruscant, Senator Amidala having come into problems with an assassin stalking her steps.

Anakin wasn’t sure but he had a feeling that if it had been just Obi-Wan and him… maybe Anakin wouldn’t be so happy.

As it was, he had Obi-Wan and he had Plo.

And maybe one day in the future he would have a little aunt or sister padawan in the togruta youngling that Plo had rescued?

Who knew.

The future was open for them to experience.
